results.title: Down in the forest
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Maslyn Williams, Department of Information and Movietone Productions
results.brief_description: The monarchs of the forests, the kangaroos, spend their lives in leisure, in cleaning and feeding their young and in friendly tussles. In the background the koalas, native wild cats, cus-cus and possums are the courtiers in the kingdom of the forest.

results.creator_credit: Terrytoon Cartoons, Paul Terry, Mannie Davis and George Gordon
results.brief_description: Features Puddy the Pup. Finding a treasure map, Puddy and his young master set out to find the gold on the ocean floor.

results.title: Down from the mountain
results.brief_description: The soundtrack for the Coen brother’s film ‘O brother, where art thou’ was to generate such interest for American bluegrass - also known as ‘mountain music’ to the initiated - that a concert of the musicians and this documentary were organised in Nashville at the Ryman Auditorium on May 24th 2000. T Bone Burnett was approached by the Coen brothers to source the musicians for the soundtrack. He gathered an electic mix of the traditional, authentic and contemporary alternative country and bluegrass music that serve to inform the breadth of this music tradition. Featuring as MC to the night is the now deceased John Hartford whose spirit and legendary status for his knowledge and musicianship of bluegrass music is captured in this documentary. The performers (amongst others) include: Fairfield Four, Alison Krauss & Union Station featuring Dan Tyminski, Gillian Welch and David Rawlings, The Cox Family, The Whites, Chris Thomas King, Colin Linden, Emmylou Harris and the soul of the show in the voice of Ralph Stanley. The documentary also includes backstage preparations and rehearsals. Directed by D A Pennebaker, Chris Hegedus and Nick Doob.

results.title: Down and out
results.creator_credit: Journal Films and Gilbert Altschul Productions
results.brief_description: The film depicts one of the most common causes of injury in workshop situations - falling. It examines the common hazards which cause people to lose their balance; over-reaching, taking short cuts, failure to check eqiupment, and not looking where one is going.
results.description: The film depicts one of the most common causes of injury in workshop situations - falling. It examines the common hazards which cause people to lose their balance; over-reaching, taking short cuts, failure to check eqiupment, and not looking where one is going.

results.title: Down a long way: the story of an oilwell
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, British Petroleum and Bob Privett
results.brief_description: Light-hearted animation describes methods of finding oil. Geologists can deduce the presence of a favourable underground formation from surface observations, and the geophysicist can then site a well, with some accuracy, by plotting the actual shape of the underground strata. Describes drilling and sampling operations which give access to the imprisoned oil.

results.title: Dovetail a drawer
results.brief_description: Explains everything from cutting the stock to size, running the groove for the drawer bottom, to cutting the dovetails and glueing up and fitting the drawer. Shows how to use a hacksaw, a chisel, and a smoothing plane with new confidence, how to rip, crosscut and plow on power machinery, how to organise the whole drawer making process from layout to finishing touches.

results.title: Dover: spring 1947
results.creator_credit: Data Film Productions, Papua New Guinea. Office of Information and Mary Beales
results.brief_description: A study of the rebuilding program of the English Channel town of Dover, which suffered heavy damage from shellfire during WWII. The historic town is to be, very largely, rebuilt on a new site, and extensive use is to be made of recently developed prefabrication techniques. Good use of British humour gives this doco additional interest.

results.title: Douglas Point Nuclear Power Station
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films and Atomic Energy of Canada
results.brief_description: The success of this first full-scale nuclear power station on the shores of Lake Huron has shown the way for the economic large-scale production of electricity from uranium. This film describes the plant at Douglas Point, Ontario, and the process by which the uranium atom is split, employing heavy water with a special property, deuterium, giving the name CANDU (Canada Deuterium Uranium) to the Canadian system of atomic energy production.

results.title: Douglas Mawson: the survivor
results.brief_description: During an expedition to Antarctica in 1912, Mawson’s two companions perished leaving him, ill and weak, to struggle back alone to a base camp at Commonwealth Bay. A reconstruction of the tragic expedition is the pivot of the documentary, which also includes interviews with the explorer-scientist’s daughters, contemporaries and students.

results.title: Dough and dynamite
results.creator_credit: Keystone Film Company, Mack Sennett and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: A Charlie Chaplin comedy concerning labor trouble in a bakehouse. Slapstick comedy at its best. Cast includes Chester Conklin, Charley Chase, Edgar Kennedy, Slim Summerville.
